programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Jimbo Fisher leads his No. 23 Aggies squad against the Lobos. Fisher, who enters his sixth season with Texas A&M, is coming off his first losing campaign since 2017, his last year at Florida State. Texas A&M is 4-0 versus New Mexico since 2008.

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: UCLA kicks off its final campaign in the Pac-12 by playing Sun Belt side Coastal Carolina at the Rose Bowl. The Bruins will begin play in the Big Ten in 2024. Tim Beck takes over as head coach of the Chanticleers following a 9-4 season in 2022.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College Football Final
programme.desc: Once the day's slate of college football games is complete, ESPN recaps the action and discusses its implications on the top 25. Matt Barrie hosts with analysts Jesse Palmer and Joey Galloway.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Jimbo Fisher leads his No. 23 Aggies squad against the Lobos. Fisher, who enters his sixth season with Texas A&M, is coming off his first losing campaign since 2017, his last year at Florida State. Texas A&M is 4-0 versus New Mexico since 2008.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Tigers host the Minutemen. Auburn hired Hugh Freeze as the 31st head coach in program history Nov. 28, 2022. Auburn also lured quarterback Payton Thorne away from Michigan State. UMass won its 2023 opener 41-30 versus New Mexico State on Aug. 26.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Formula 1: Grand Prix Sunday
programme.desc: Teams make final preparations for the day's race. Plus, interviews, features, and Martin Brundle's popular "grid walk."

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing
programme.desc: From Autodromo Nazionale Monza in Monza, Lombardy, Italy.

programme.title: 2023 U.S. Open Tennis
programme.desc: From the USTA Billie Jean King National Tennis Center in Flushing, N.Y.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Hard Rock Stadium in Miami hosts this SWAC matchup between Jackson State and Florida A&M. Last season, the Tigers routed the Rattlers 59-3 for a second consecutive season-opening victory. Jackson State pumped South Carolina State 37-7 on Aug. 26.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight: Sunday Night Countdown
programme.desc: Leading into each of ESPN's Sunday Night Baseball telecasts is this special edition of "Baseball Tonight." Host Karl Ravech teams with analysts and reporters to present fans a detailed preview of the network's exclusive, national game of the week. Highlights of the day's other games, interviews with players and managers, and key storylines from around the league also fill the hourlong show. Mark Teixeira, Eduardo PÃ©rez, Tim Kurkjian and Buster Olney are among the analysts.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: The Astros put an end to their season series with the Yankees in a Sunday Night Baseball matchup. New York's Michael King hasn't allowed an earned run in his last two starts, and held Houston scoreless across a pair of relief appearances in August.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: UCLA kicks off its final campaign in the Pac-12 by playing Sun Belt side Coastal Carolina at the Rose Bowl. The Bruins will begin play in the Big Ten in 2024. Tim Beck takes over as head coach of the Chanticleers following a 9-4 season in 2022.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: 2023 U.S. Open Tennis
programme.desc: From the USTA Billie Jean King National Tennis Center in Flushing, N.Y.

programme.title: College Football Countdown
programme.desc: A look at the day's college football action, featuring news, highlights and game previews.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: A seldom-seen ACC showdown begins the 2023 campaign for the No. 9 Tigers and Blue Devils. The two sides have met just twice across the past 15 seasons, with Clemson winning both decisively. Mike Elko led Duke to a 9-4 record and a bowl win in 2022.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Cougars play their first match as members of the Big 12 as they host the Roadrunners. After going 9-0 in Conference USA play last year, UTSA moved to the American Athletic Conference. Houston topped UTSA 37-35 in triple overtime last season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Cougars begin their first season as a member of the Big 12 when they host the Bearkats. BYU competed as an independent for the last 12 years. Sam Houston State, the 2020 FCS champion, begins its first FBS campaign, as a Conference USA club.

programme.title: The Joel Klatt Show: Big Noon Conversations

programme.title: Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: Mike Bibby scored 23 points, and Chris Webber had 29 points and 13 rebounds as the Kings moved within one game of the franchise's first trip to the NBA Finals since 1951, beating the Lakers 92-91 to take a 3-2 lead in the Western Conference finals.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Aces look to notch their first four-game regular-season sweep of the Storm since 2007. Las Vegas has dominated Seattle in 2023, winning the three meetings by an average of 30 points. Jackie Young (LVA) averaged 24.3 points per game in the wins.

programme.title: Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: The Warriors' trio of "Run TMC" combine for 71 points in a win against the Spurs. Game 3 of the 1991 Western Conference first-round playoffs.

programme.title: NBA Rewind With Ahmad Rashad
programme.desc: Ahmad Rashad talks with "Run TMC" (Tim Hardaway, Mitch Richmond and Chris Mullin) about leadership, the current Warriors' roster, their heyday, and more.

programme.title: Run TMC: The Power of Three
programme.desc: Former Golden State Warriors Chris Mullin, Tim Hardaway and Mitch Richmond discuss their time together in the '90s.

programme.title: NBA Playoff Playback
programme.desc: Stephen Curry makes seven 3-pointers and scores 37 points, and the Warriors withstood another brilliant performance from LeBron James to outlast the Cleveland Cavaliers 104-91 for a 3-2 lead in the NBA Finals. From June 14, 2015.

programme.title: NBA Playoffs - Popcast
programme.desc: The "Splash Brothers," Steph Curry and Klay Thompson, help Golden State rally from a 3-1 series deficit to beat the Oklahoma City Thunder 96-88 in Game 7 of the Western Conference finals. From May 30, 2016.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Game 5. The Warriors and Cavaliers collide in the Finals for the third consecutive year. Game 5 turns out to be a high-scoring battle between superstars LeBron James (CLE) and Kevin Durant (GS).

programme.title: NBA Playoff Playback
programme.desc: Game 1, NBA Finals. From May 31, 2018.

programme.title: 2022 NBA Finals
programme.desc: Exhibiting a determined confidence and grit all game, Andrew Wiggins single-handedly took the pressure off Stephen Curry and delivered the best game yet of his eight-year career. Wiggins had 26 points and 13 rebounds as he led the Warriors to victory for a 3-2 series lead.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: Diamond Miller and the Lynx look to move one step closer to clinching a playoff berth as they host the Mercury. Minnesota leads the yearly set 2-1, pushing its record against Phoenix to 25-4 (including playoffs) since the start of the 2016 season.

programme.title: NBA Rewind With Ahmad Rashad
programme.desc: Ahmad Rashad sits down with Stephen Curry to discuss his basketball journey, life, and golf.

programme.title: Stephen Curry: The Art of the 3
programme.desc: Pacers legend Reggie Miller, who previously held the record for the most three-point shots of all time, and Warriors superstar Stephen Curry, who is rapidly approaching the title, discuss the art of 3.

programme.title: 2022 NBA Finals
programme.desc: In a dominating performance that was also one of his best playoff games of his career, Stephen Curry scored 43 points to lead the Golden State Warriors to a 107-97 victory over the Boston Celtics in Game 4 to even the series.

programme.title: Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: Golden State became the first No. 8 seed to capture a best-of-seven playoff series with a 111-86 victory over the NBA-best Dallas Mavericks in Game 6.

programme.title: Players Only: Splash Bros & Bad Boys
programme.desc: Golden State's Stephen Curry and Klay Thompson sit down with Isiah Thomas and Joe Dumars for a wide-ranging conversation.

programme.title: Players Only: Isiah & Magic
programme.desc: Isiah Thomas and Magic Johnson are together to tell the history of their friendship and rivalry.

programme.title: Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: In a classic battle, Isiah Thomas' 43 points are not enough as the Lakers defeat the Pistons in Game 6 of the 1988 NBA Finals by a score of 103-102.

programme.title: Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: Game 7 of the 1988 NBA Finals. Finals MVP James Worthy's triple double (36-16-10) helps the Lakers beat the Pistons to win the NBA title.

programme.title: Big Game James: The James Worthy Story
programme.desc: The career of the former Los Angeles Lakers' star.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: LeBron James scored a season-high 47 points on his 38th birthday with many of the sellout crowd cheering his every move, and the Lakers beat the Hawks 130-121. James, a 4-time NBA MVP and an 18-time All-Star, finished with 10 rebounds and 9 assists.

programme.title: NBA 75: 75 Stories
programme.desc: Pioneers who have helped shape, define and redefine the game of basketball.

programme.title: NBA Rewind With Ahmad Rashad
programme.desc: Shaq sits down to discuss breaking backboards, his top five players, and being a dominant player.

programme.title: Tough Love: Shaq & Kareem
programme.desc: Shaquille O'Neal and Kareem Abdul-Jabbar sit down to discuss their relationship and past, as well as how the NBA has evolved.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: LeBron James became the NBA's career scoring leader on a step-back jumper late in the third quarter, passing Kareem Abdul-Jabbar's record during his 38-point performance in the Lakers' 133-130 loss to the Thunder. From Feb. 7, 2023.

programme.title: High Tops
programme.desc: We highlight the top plays and moments from the legendary career of LeBron James in his quest to become the NBA's all-time leading scorer.

programme.title: Players Only: Shaq and Kobe
programme.desc: Basketball legends and former teammates Shaquille O'Neal and Kobe Bryant sit down for a conversation, covering everything from their three consecutive championships with the Los Angeles Lakers to their relationship over the years.

programme.title: 2000 NBA Finals
programme.desc: Shaquille O'Neal's dominant performance of 41 points and 12 rebounds lead the Lakers to the 2000 NBA Championship. From June 19, 2000.

programme.title: 2001 NBA Finals
programme.desc: Shaquille O'Neal scores 29 points as the Lakers win back-to-back NBA Championships. From June 15, 2001.

programme.title: 2002 NBA Finals
programme.desc: Game 4. Shaquille O'Neal scores 34 points and is awarded his third straight NBA Finals MVP, as the Lakers win their third consecutive NBA Championship. From June 12, 2002.

programme.title: Shaqtin' a Fool
programme.desc: Shaq takes a look back at the 2022-23 NBA Season.

programme.title: Shaq: The Big Conversation
programme.desc: A one-on-one interview with Shaquille O'Neal,conducted by his TNT colleague and "Inside the NBA" host Ernie Johnson. Shaq chats about his childhood and his relationship with his stepfather and how both influenced his Hall of Fame career.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Paul George hit a go-ahead jumper with six seconds remaining, finishing with 35 points and six steals as the Clippers edged past the Rockets 95-93 to snap a four-game losing streak. From Oct. 31, 2022.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Norman Powell scored a season-high 30 points, Reggie Jackson added a season-best 27 and the Clippers rallied in the fourth to defeat the Jazz 121-114. Jordan Clarkson led Utah with 26 points and Lauri Markkanen had 25 and 10. From Nov. 21, 2022.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Kawhi Leonard had 16 points, including an 18-foot jumper with 1.4 seconds remaining to lift the Clippers to a 119-117 victory over the Hornets in his return from a right ankle sprain. From Dec. 5, 2022.

programme.title: NBA Playoff Playback
programme.desc: Blake Griffin scores 24 points, Chris Paul has 22 points and 14 assists, and the Los Angeles Clippers outlast the Golden State Warriors 126-121 in Game 7 to win their thrilling first-round playoff series.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Kawhi Leonard continued his hot play with 30 points, Paul George had 24 and the Clippers overcame Stephen Curry's 50-point night to beat the Warriors, 134-126. Curry tied a season high with the 12th 50-point game of his career. From March 15, 2023.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Norman Powell scored 27 points, Kawhi Leonard added 25 in a game-high 43 minutes and the Clippers improved their playoff seeding chances with a 125-118 win over LeBron James and the Lakers. From April 5, 2023.

programme.desc: The Fever try to reel in the Sky in the finale of their season series. Chicago holds a 2-1 edge on Indiana, but all three games have been within two points at the end of regulation. Courtney Williams (CHI) scored 28 points in an 89-87 win on July 2.
